top_categories.workout_context: Racing Highlands Gravel Classic isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Highlands Gravel Classic’s chunky gravel, loose rock demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Highlands Gravel Classic’s chunky ozark gravel with constant rolling hills and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Highlands Gravel Classic rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Highlands Gravel Classic — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Highlands Gravel Classic’s chunky ozark gravel with constant rolling hills drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Highlands Gravel Classic — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on chunky ozark gravel with constant rolling hills.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Highlands Gravel Classic when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Highlands Gravel Classic. Make this intensity feel like home.
The varied gradients at Highlands Gravel Classic reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Highlands Gravel Classic’s chunky ozark gravel with constant rolling hills delivers on race day.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Highlands Gravel Classic — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Highlands Gravel Classic’s 67 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Highlands Gravel Classic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on chunky ozark gravel with constant rolling hills to build confidence. Expect: chunky gravel, loose rock, tree-covered roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and VO2max to prepare you for 67 miles of chunky ozark gravel with constant rolling hills in Goshen, Arkansas.
